snippet: American military officials are waging an unusually public campaign against the plan to free 65 prisoners, considered dangerous insurgents, from the military prison in Bagram.
abstract: American military officials in Afghanistan complain that Afghan authorities have ordered release of more prisoners that American considers to be dangerous insurgents; contentious releases, and unusually public campaign being waged against them by American military, are indications two countries have concluded that they cannot quietly resolve their major differences over issue.

byline.contributor: Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kabul; Azam Ahmed from Bagram, Afghanistan; and Matthew Rosenberg from Washington.

lead_paragraph: American military officials are waging an unusually public campaign against the plan to free 65 prisoners, considered dangerous insurgents, from the military prison in Bagram.

headline.main: U.S. Military Denounces Afghanistan’s Planned Release of More Prisoners
headline.print_headline: U.S. Military Denounces Planned Release of More Prisoners by Afghanistan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
